clinical_study.brief_title: The Relation Between Scapular Muscle Endurance, Pain, Muscle Strength, and Function in Patients With Rotator Cuff Lesion
clinical_study.official_title: The Relation Between Scapular Muscle Endurance, Pain, Muscle Strength, and Function in Patients With Rotator Cuff Lesion

brief_summary.textblock: Rotator cuff lesions (RCL) are one of the most common shoulder joint disorders. The most important cause of RCL is the impairment of the balance of synergies and force couples of muscles responsible for scapulothoracic stabilization.This study aims to investigate the relationship between scapular muscle endurance (SME), pain, muscle strength, and function in patients with shoulder RCL.

detailed_description.textblock: Eighty nine patients with shoulder RCL and 32 healthy controls were evaluated. Patients with subacromial impingement syndrome (SIS) (n:25) and partial rotator cuff tears (PRCT) (n:28), who met the inclusion criteria, and 23 healthy controls were included in the study. Participants were assessed for SME, pain (rest, activity, night), shoulder girdle and scapular muscle strengths and upper extremity function (FIT-HaNSA). In addition, Constant & Murley score, the Shoulder Pain and Disability Index (SPADI), and the Nottingham Health Profile (NHP) were administered.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcome - Shoulder Pain And Disability Index (SPADI).
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire contains 13 items with a possible score from 0-100 (0=no disability).

primary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcome - Constant & Murley score
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire contains 8 items with a possible score from 0-100

primary_outcome.measure: Patient Reported Outcome - Nottingham Health Profile

arm_group.description: Participants were assessed for SME, pain (rest, activity, night), shoulder girdle and scapular muscle strengths and upper extremity function (FIT-HaNSA). In addition, Constant & Murley score, the Shoulder Pain and Disability Index (SPADI), and the Nottingham Health Profile (NHP) were administered.

Participants were assessed for SME, pain (rest, activity, night), shoulder girdle and scapular muscle strengths and upper extremity function (FIT-HaNSA). In addition, Constant & Murley score, the Shoulder Pain and Disability Index (SPADI), and the Nottingham Health Profile (NHP) were administered.

Participants were assessed for SME, shoulder girdle and scapular muscle strengths and upper extremity function (FIT-HaNSA). In addition, Constant & Murley score, the Shoulder Pain and Disability Index (SPADI), and the Nottingham Health Profile (NHP) were administered.

intervention.intervention_name: Scapular muscle endurance test, pain, Range of Motion, Strength, Upper Limp Functional Performance, outcome scores

study_pop.textblock: Fifty three patients and 23 healthy subjects who met the inclusion criteria were included to the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Positive sign in two or more specific shoulder clinical tests;
- Presence of RCL (subacromial impingement syndrome (SIS) or PRCT) in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
- At least 120° flexion, 30° abduction and 30° external rotation movements of the shoulder;
- The dominant arm that all the individuals who involved in the study use is the right one;
- No surgical history in the shoulder region,
- No history of physiotherapy in the shoulder region in the previous 3 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a neurological and systemic inflammatory diseases,
- bilateral shoulder complaints, neck pain, and fracture history in the shoulder region, and patients with a frozen shoulder, full-thickness rotator cuff tear on MRI,
- cardiovascular system diseases,
- pregnant women were excluded.
